subject: Re: [junit] Each data unit that is loaded from XML file can be executed in each method respectively?
msgSnippet: Cool. It is really what I want! Thank David. http://www.testearly.com/2007/04/13/take-heed-of-mixing-junit-4s-parameterized-tests/ The link as above
messageBody:
Cool. It is really what I want! Thank David.

http://www.testearly.com/2007/04/13/take-heed-of-mixing-junit-4s-parameterized-tests/

The link as above demonstrates the usage of @RunWith(Parameters.class)

Of course, you also refer to the Junit4 DOC as followings:

http://junit.sourceforge.net/javadoc_40/org/junit/runners/Parameterized.html

Regards.


2008/12/3 David Saff <david@...>

> Have you looked at the @RunWith(Parameters.class) feature in JUnit 4?
>
> David Saff
>
> 2008/11/30 王凌华 <mmchut.wang@... <mmchut.wang%40gmail.com>>:
>
> > Yang,
> >
> > Thanks for your feedback.
> >
> > What I have done - - - - - -
> >
> > Target class to test:
> > public class Target {
> > public static boolean checkSomething(String para1,String para2,String
> para3)
> > {
> > //Some logics here.
> > }
> >
> > Test class:
> > public class TestTarget {
> > ...
> > public static List<String[]> *paraList* = new ArrayList<String[]>()* *;
> > //Each line, each String array.
> > @Test public void testCheckSomething() {
> > // for loop *paraList*
> >
> > for(String[] para:*paraList*) {
> > boolean result =Target.checkSomething(para[0],para[1],para[2]);
> > AssertEquals(result,Boolean.valueOf(para[3]).booleanValue());
> > }
> > }
> >
> > @BeforeClass public void readTestData {
> > // Read Test Data from XML, Text, or csv file. Each line has four
> columns,
> > one,two and three columns will be passed para1,para2,para3 of
> > Target.checkSomething method, the last one is the expect result.
> > }
> > ...
> > }
> >
> > A bunch of tests will be executed, is not it? Seem that sometimes it is
> not
> > a easy thing to locate which cases has been failed if failture
> encountered.
> > Is there any way to improve JUnit design for this case here? Any
> suggestion
> > would be appriciated.
> >
> > Thanks.
> >
> > 2008/11/30 Yang Gu <hyysguyang@... <hyysguyang%40gmail.com>>
> >
> >> Hi,
> >>
> >>
> >> 王凌华 Wrote:
> >>
> >> >>Now The problem is that all cases can be only designed to be in a
> >> method ( I do the 'for loop' to let
> >> >>each unit input test against the fixture.)
> >>
> >> Why all cases designed in a method?
> >>
> >> >>it means that in this case many tests happened in one method.
> >> Why many tests happened in one method?
> >>
> >> >>Is there any way to execute a test in a method?
> >>
> >> Do you mean run a test?
> >>
> >> In junit,one test is a method with annotation Test (Junit 4)，I am
> >> confused with your description and not get your intent,could you give
> >> some concrete example?
> >>
> >> --
> >> Please be free contact with me for any question or suggestion.
> >> Thanks&Best Regards .
> >> Yang.Gu
